entities.description: "Harriet Hageman is a political figure who received the most votes in a primary election, as mentioned by Ms. Cheney."

"Ms. Cheney is a supporter who announced Harriet Hageman's victory in a primary election and called for Americans to stand up to Mr. Trump and others who deny his loss in the 2020 presidential election."
"Mr. Trump is mentioned as someone who, along with others, denies his loss in the 2020 presidential election, according to Ms. Cheney."
The 2020 Presidential Election is an event where Mr. Trump is claimed to have lost, and it is a point of contention for those who deny his loss.
"Andrew M. Cuomo is a former governor who won an ethics lawsuit, allowing him to keep the proceeds from his book deal about the pandemic."
"Ukraine is a country whose government is working to save businesses from Russian bombs by moving factories west, creating a new industrial and economic heartland."
"Russia is a country that earns billions of dollars from the production of diamonds, which other nations claim help finance war, and is also bombing businesses in eastern Ukraine."
"Kenya is a country where Raila Odinga, who lost the presidential election, plans to use all legal options to fight the result."
"The Jesuits are an order that set a goal to raise $100 million to make amends for their role in the slave trade, but donations have been slow."
"Sabrina Ionescu is a player relied upon by the Liberty in the W.N.B.A. playoffs, having a breakout season in her third year."
"The production of Russian gems, particularly diamonds, is an event that earns Russia billions of dollars and is claimed to finance war by other nations."
"The Kenya Vote refers to the nation's presidential election, the result of which Raila Odinga, the loser, plans to legally challenge."
"The Jesuits' Atonement Fund is an event where the Jesuits aim to raise $100 million to atone for their role in the slave trade, but have seen slow donations."

"The Supreme Court's decision on whether Andy Warhol's interpretation of a photograph of Prince is protected as a transformative work is an event that addresses the intersection of art and copyright."
"Taquiza is an event suggested for an end-of-summer party where guests can make their own tacos from a spread of ingredients."
"Salvage Stores Catch On refers to the event where frugal shoppers find bargains in dented cans, ignored sell-by dates, and new-product flops."
"The ‘Saul’ Time Machine is an event that describes the TV show 'Better Call Saul' and its finale, which seamlessly looked back at the character's past and forward to his future."
"The W.N.B.A. playoffs is an event where the Liberty team is relying on Sabrina Ionescu for a strong performance in her third year."

relationships.description: "Ms. Cheney announced Harriet Hageman's victory in the primary election."
"Ms. Cheney called for Americans to stand up to Mr. Trump and others who deny his loss in the 2020 presidential election."

entities.description: "The New York Times Company is the publisher of the newspaper, providing news and information to its readers."
"Henry Fountain is the author of the article discussing water restrictions in the Colorado River and its impact on Arizona and Nevada."
"The Colorado River is a significant water source in the Southwest, currently facing a crisis due to low water levels and drought."
"Lake Powell is a reservoir on the Colorado River, located on the Arizona-Utah border, with water levels at 28 percent of total capacity."
"Lake Mead is another reservoir on the Colorado River, with water levels at 28 percent of total capacity due to diminished flow and increased demand."
"Arizona is a state facing new restrictions on the amount of water that can be pumped out of the Colorado River due to the water crisis."
"Nevada is a state facing new restrictions on the amount of water that can be pumped out of the Colorado River due to the water crisis."
"Mexico is affected by the new water cuts imposed on the Colorado River, which supplies water to 40 million people in the United States and Mexico."
"Michael Schwirtz is the author of the article discussing Ukraine's military tactics against Crimea."
"Anton Troianovski is the co-author of the article discussing Ukraine's military tactics against Crimea."
"Ukraine is a country that has been conducting clandestine assaults against Crimea, which is under Russian occupation."
"Crimea is a peninsula that has been illegally annexed by Russia in 2014 and is now a vital staging ground for Russia's invasion."
"Vladimir V. Putin is the President of Russia, who has called Crimea a 'sacred place' and warned of severe consequences if it is attacked."
"Christina Jewett is the author of the article discussing the FDA's decision to allow over-the-counter sales of hearing aids."
"The Food and Drug Administration is a government agency that has decided to allow hearing aids to be sold over the counter without a prescription to adults."
"Russian warships patrol Crimea's coasts, indicating Russia's military presence and control over the area."
"Russian warplanes operate from Crimea, highlighting the region's use as a base for Russian military operations."
"Kyiv is the capital of Ukraine, where the government is leveraging Western weapons and special forces to conduct military operations."
"The elite Ukrainian military unit is responsible for the blasts in Crimea, operating behind enemy lines and challenging Russian occupation."
"Russia's Defense Ministry acknowledged the Crimea explosions as an 'act of sabotage,' indicating the spread of the war to Russian territory."
"'Judgment Day' is a term used by a Russian top adviser to describe the severe consequences Ukraine would face if Crimea were attacked."
"The Black Sea peninsula refers to Crimea, which is the target of Ukrainian assaults and a vital staging ground for Russia's invasion."
"Putin's annexation of Crimea is the event where Russia took control of the peninsula in 2014, which has significant political implications for Putin's image and Russia's military efforts."

relationships.description: "Henry Fountain is a writer for The New York Times Company, contributing articles on various topics."
"Arizona is a state that relies on the Colorado River for water, and is now facing restrictions on water pumping."
"Nevada is a state that relies on the Colorado River for water, and is now facing restrictions on water pumping."
"Lake Powell is a reservoir on the Colorado River, significantly affected by the water crisis."
"Lake Mead is a reservoir on the Colorado River, significantly affected by the water crisis."
"Vladimir V. Putin is the Russian President who annexed Crimea in 2014, significantly impacting his political standing and Russia's military efforts."
"The annexation of Crimea by Putin transformed the peninsula into a fortress and a vital staging ground for Russia's invasion."

entities.description: "Joe Biden is the President of the United States who signed a significant tax, health, and energy bill aimed at modernizing the American economy and reducing dependence on fossil fuels."

"The Inflation Reduction Act is a landmark legislation signed by President Biden, which includes provisions to lower prescription drug costs, extend health insurance subsidies, and reduce the federal deficit, among other things."
"Medicare is a federal program that provides health insurance for seniors, and the Inflation Reduction Act includes provisions to lower prescription drug costs for seniors on Medicare."
"The American economy is the focus of President Biden's goal to modernize it and reduce its dependence on fossil fuels through the Inflation Reduction Act."
"Washington is the location where President Biden signed the Inflation Reduction Act into law."

"Donald J. Trump is the former President of the United States who approved a \$3.1 trillion relief package in 2020, and his actions and influence are mentioned in the context of the fraud during the pandemic and the Republican Party."
"Richard Ayvazyan is part of a ring that sought billions in loans and received 17 years in prison, mentioned in the context of pandemic-related fraud."
"Liz Cheney is a Representative from Wyoming and a vocal critic of Donald J. Trump, who lost her Republican primary to Harriet Hageman."
"Harriet Hageman is a lawyer in Cheyenne who was endorsed by Donald J. Trump and won the Republican primary against Liz Cheney."
"Costco is a retailer where hearing aids are available at a lower cost compared to other providers, starting at about \$1,400."
"Electric utilities are entities that will be helped by the legislation to switch to lower-emission sources of energy."
"Americans are the general population who will be encouraged to buy electric vehicles through tax credits provided by the legislation."
"Congressional Democrats are the group of politicians who engaged in intense negotiations for over a year to pass the Inflation Reduction Act."
"The Democratic Party is the political party to which President Biden belongs and which has a razor-thin majority in the House and Senate."
"The House of Representatives is one of the two chambers of the United States Congress where the Democratic Party has a slim majority."
"The Senate is the upper chamber of the United States Congress where the Democratic Party holds a narrow majority."
"The F.B.I. is involved in investigating pandemic-fraud cases along with other federal agencies."
"The Secret Service is one of the federal agencies working on pandemic-fraud cases."
"The Postal Inspection Service is involved in the investigation of fraud related to the pandemic."
"The Internal Revenue Service is a federal agency that has charged people with defrauding pandemic-aid programs."
"The 'Do Not Pay List' is a government list that includes people who should not receive payments, yet some of them received relief money during the pandemic."
"'N/A' refers to the non-applicable or not available designation used by 342 people who received loans during the pandemic, indicating potential fraud."
"The Jan. 6 Capitol Attack is an event that Liz Cheney, as vice chairwoman of the committee investigating it, is vocally against and which is central to her political stance against Donald J. Trump."
"The Republican Party is the political party that Donald J. Trump is campaigning to purge of his critics, including Liz Cheney."

relationships.description: "Joe Biden signed the Inflation Reduction Act into law, which is a significant part of his economic agenda."
"Joe Biden's Inflation Reduction Act includes provisions that will lower prescription drug costs for seniors on Medicare."
"Joe Biden's goal includes modernizing the American economy through the Inflation Reduction Act."
"Donald J. Trump's campaign to purge the Republican Party of his critics led to Liz Cheney's defeat in the Republican primary."
"Harriet Hageman was endorsed by Donald J. Trump and won the Republican primary against Liz Cheney."
"Harriet Hageman defeated Liz Cheney in the Republican primary, ending Cheney's role in Congress."
"The Inflation Reduction Act includes provisions to help electric utilities switch to lower-emission sources of energy."
"Congressional Democrats were involved in intense negotiations to pass the Inflation Reduction Act."
"The Inflation Reduction Act was passed with the support of the Democratic Party, which holds a slim majority in Congress."
